items.description: Overleaf + LaTeX used; final PDF submitted
GitHub commit hash provided and resolves
DOCSTRING-GTusername has runnable instructions (env/deps/entry point)
Report length ≤ 8 pages (main text)
Figures/text legible at 100% zoom (≤2 hard-to-read plots)
References are consistent (MLA/APA/IEEE OK) and include ≥1 source beyond course material

items: Missing/invalid GitHub hash or repo not runnable from instructions
Instructions live only on GitHub, not in the DOCSTRING (deduct)
>8 pages; note for future reports
≥3 figures hard to read at 100%
References inconsistent; lacks outside literature; style includes body text in bibliography

items.description: Brief but clear ML framing (structure, noise)
Noted class imbalance, missingness/outliers, continuous vs categorical mix
Justified classification vs regression target(s) for this dataset

items: Deeper EDA on missing data/outliers or target imbalance
Clearer rationale for chosen target(s) and why alternatives weren't used

items.description: Clear ML relevance (spatiotemporal, weather/POI enrichment)
Mentioned imbalance, feature types, possible reporting bias
Justified classification vs regression target(s) for this dataset

items: Sparse EDA; needs more on missingness or post-event fields (leakage risk)
Stronger justification of target framing and constraints

items.description: Explicit hypothesis states expected algorithm ordering/behaviors
Grounded in lecture/paper/theory or minimal EDA evidence

items: Hypothesis vague or unfalsifiable
Lacks citation or tie-in to course material / literature

items.description: Returned to hypothesis in Discussion/Conclusion
Cited specific numbers/figures/tables to support or refute

items: Conclusion does not explicitly resolve the hypothesis
References trends qualitatively without quantitative evidence

items.description: Error metrics justified for tasks (classification vs regression)
Learning Curves — Hotel: Valid LC + bias/variance trends + iterative improvements
Learning Curves — US Accidents: Valid LC + trends + iterative adjustments
Model Complexity — Hotel: Valid validation curve + interpretation + refinement
Model Complexity — US Accidents: Valid MC plot + interpretation + refinement

items: Missing/incorrect metrics; no rationale for classification vs regression errors
No pruning or no ccp_alpha path; depth/leaf sizing unexamined
LC/MC plots missing for one/both datasets or axes/curves incomplete
Trends listed without linking to data or DT properties

items.description: Error metrics justified
Learning Curves — Hotel: Valid LC + bias/variance patterns + iterative tuning
Learning Curves — US Accidents: Valid LC + trends + curse of dimensionality discussion
Model Complexity — Hotel: MC plot vs k + interpretation + justification
Model Complexity — US Accidents: MC plot + interpretation + data property ties

items: Features not scaled; metric/weighting not discussed
Only one value of k considered; MC plot missing
No discussion of imbalance effects in neighborhoods

items.description: Error metrics justified
Learning Curves — Hotel: Valid LC + bias/variance + iterative C/γ/degree tuning
Learning Curves — US Accidents: Valid LC + trends + kernel choice connection
Model Complexity — Hotel: MC plot vs C/γ/degree + interpretation + kernel justification
Model Complexity — US Accidents: MC plot + interpretation + data trait ties

items: Features not scaled; only one kernel (need ≥2 kernels)
Probabilities reported without calibration rationale
MC/LC missing or not linked to SVM inductive biases

items.description: Error metrics justified
Learning Curves — Hotel: Valid data-size LC + epoch LC + bias/variance + regularization
Learning Curves — US Accidents: Valid LC + trends + scale/imbalance discussion
Model Complexity — Hotel: MC plot vs hyperparameter + interpretation + architecture justification
Model Complexity — US Accidents: MC plot + interpretation + dataset complexity ties

items: Missing epoch-wise LC; only final scores shown
No standardization of inputs; heads/losses mismatched to task
No calibration when thresholding; imbalance untreated

items.description: Clear wrap-up with Type I/II tied to thresholds or residuals
≥3 evidence-backed takeaways comparing algorithms & datasets
Connects to course concepts (generalization, CV, bias–variance, proper metrics)
Notes limitations and one concrete next step; cites figures/tables

items: Too generic; lacks Type I/II or concrete, numbered takeaways
Weak linkage to course concepts; limited cross-dataset comparison

sections.main_section: Extra Credit: Neural Network Activation Tests (up to 5)

items.description: NN only, SGD only, one dataset, four activations; all non-activation factors held constant
Validation curves (loss + primary metric), comparison table, 3+ seeds (mean±std)
Insightful analysis: convergence speed/stability, calibration/residuals, trade-offs

items: Missing activations / uncontrolled changes (LR/init/reg) / incomplete curves or metrics
Descriptive commentary without diagnosing stability or trade-offs
